H-h-h-how's it going, bros? My name is Tooooorg9776 (the opening doesn't work with me )

Pewdiepie has stated that people have been telling him to play our glorious game. I know that some of you, no doubt, are behind it as well, but for those of you who don't know that he has been asked to... Do you think it would be a good thing if he tried it out? Furthermore, what do you think would be the benefits of having the most subscribed person on YouTube play the game, if you think there are any?
this has already been discussed quite a bit i'm sorry to say

I think most people would agree it would bring... unwanted people to our happy little community. Anyone who knows about Pewds understands what his fans are like. On the lus side though, the stereotypical PDP fan wouldn't be the type to stay with a game with a learning curve as steep as KSP. Those who do stay can be salvaged into good members of the community.

On an important side note though, Squad would get a lot of coverage and can make some money.
It would bring as stated above a lot of unwanted people to our community. But the sales would be enormous,a good thing for Squad.

I want to see the game do well, so Pewdiepie would be excellent! I wouldn't worry too much about "unwanted" people coming into the community, as the game's natural learning curve will ensure that impatient people quit very soon.

It would probably result in a huge storm on the forums as all the noobs are complaining that the game is too hard. But as Capt_Reynolds said, some of them would surely have the patience to actually learn how to play the game, and it would bring a lot of publicity. The forums would eventually calm down again.

Although I'm not too sure that pewds' style of playing would show the "sciencey" side of the game, which I think is the part that makes it interesting. He wouldn't even try to do things the right way, he'd just build random useless things and watch them explode. If he did get his rocket to Kerbin orbit, there's just no way he could ever get to another planet... Well, maybe he'd get to Duna or Eve with a bit of luck, but he certainly wouldn't make it to the outer planets or moons.

Edited January 2, 2014 by KasperVld

The pie kids where all over the just cause 2 multiplayer mod, lets just say it was bad....

But this game isn't multiplayer, so you wouldn't need to be around them.

But on the forums.......oh no.

a game with a learning curve as steep as KSP.

I agree.

(rough, biased graph)
People think that the "Bros" will invade the forums, and wreck it. I don't think of this, as for more moderators will be hired

I didn't even know who this person was until the first time I saw a thread about him on this forum a few months back. I thought his name was "pew die pie" like he's shooting a pie with a laser gun.

This must be what it felt like for my parents when people started getting into "Fifty Cents" and "Iced Tea." I've avoided it for quite some time but I think it's official. I'm old.
I vote other because i don't care. He can play it and i'm sure it won't affect the game or the forums in any way. (That still doesn't mean that i like him or his channel)

Great deal of his fans are brainless people, but not all of them. There might be some initial problems on the forums, but I think the overall effect would be a nice financial boost for Squad from the increasing sales, and the forums can be kept clean if the mods do their job. More money for Squad, more KSP development.

I have only heard of this person in passing. Honestly though, the more people playing (and buying) the game, the merrier.

As for forum wastage, I doubt it would happen. Even a full-scale 4chan invasion could probably be weathered (just barely) by this place. I've brought myself to watch some of his videos, and they entertained me some. However, I wish in NO WAY to express that I'm a "bro" and I do not consider me one.

That being said, I don't care if he plays KSP. The mods will just go into over-drive and zap any threads made saying "ROCKIT NO WURK HLP ME!!!!!!!1!!!!!!!!!1"

Well, I think it's a good thing. More money means faster development.

As for the 'Forum Panic', no need to worry about that. We have better moderators than a lot of places. Certainly, it's better than 4Chan (I'm not sure if that monstrosity even HAS moderators). The mods will weed out the poop, and we'll be left with the good stuff.
People felt the same way about the Steam influx.

(I'm not sure if that monstrosity even HAS moderators)

It does, but they have almost no rules aside from stay roughly on topic.
Although it would do good for sales. I think the community would turn into something like what the Minecraft community became.

It does, but they have almost no rules aside from stay roughly on topic.

And no Chanology or protest-posting. They never forgot the monster they created in 2008 with THAT one.

I'm pretty indifferent on whether he plays or not. On one side it would introduce many people to the game and squad would do very well for a while. Also I'm sure that many of his fans are intelligent and reasonable people.

However I'm not keen on the idea of swarms of people who will only play for a week or two flooding the forums!

Anyway Steam is way bigger than pewdiepie and we survived the influx from that quite easily.
